Class DeckPool

java.lang.Object
logic.gamesystem.DeckPool
public class DeckPool extends Object
Represents a pool of cards used for random card drawing.

A DeckPool maintains a list of Card objects and allows callers to draw a number of random cards. Each draw:

  • Selects a random card from the pool
  • Removes it temporarily
  • Creates a new card instance via Card.createNew()
  • Adds the new instance to the draw result
  • Restores the fresh instance (not the template) back into the pool
Important: Unlike a template-based pool, this implementation gradually replaces original templates with the newly created card instances returned by Card.createNew(). This behavior is documented and intentional unless changed by the developer.

  • Constructor Details

    • DeckPool

      public DeckPool()
      Creates an empty DeckPool. Cards must be added manually before drawing.

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public void addCard(Card template)
      Adds a single card to the pool. The card is stored directly as-is.
      Parameters:
      template - the card to add; ignored if null

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all cards from the pool.

    • drawRandom

      public List<Card> drawRandom(int n)
      Draws n cards at random from the pool.

      For each draw:

      • A random card is selected
      • The card is removed temporarily
      • Card.createNew() is used to produce a new instance
      • The new instance is added to the result list
      • The new instance is also restored back into the pool

      If the pool is empty, an empty list is returned.

      Parameters:
      n - number of cards to draw
      Returns:
      a list containing n freshly created cards

    • getPool

      public List<Card> getPool()
      Returns a direct reference to the internal card pool.

      Modifications to the returned list will affect this DeckPool.

      Returns:
      the internal list of cards
